messages.content: You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: GAR4-DUAL POWER MOD ZY104
ID: ZY104_1
  ***Properties***
    Status [id=ST]
      Enum [uom id=78]
        Off [0]
        On [100]
        Unknown [101]
    Responding [id=ERR]
      Enum [uom id=25]
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
        Parameter 1: name=n/a [id=n/a]
          Enum [uom id=78]
            Off [0]
            On [100]
    Off [DOF]
    Query [QUERY]
    Set Configuration [CONFIG]
        Parameter 1: name=Parameter Number [id=NUM]
        Parameter 2: name=Parameter Value [id=VAL]
          Range 0 to 255 Unit 1 Byte (Unsigned) [uom id=107]
          Range 0 to 65535 Unit 2 Bytes (Unsigned) [uom id=108]
          Range 0 to 4294967295 Unit 4 Bytes (Unsigned) [uom id=110]
          Range -128 to 127 Unit 1 Byte [uom id=111]
          Range -32768 to 32767 Unit 2 Byte [uom id=112]
          Range -2147483648 to 214748647 Unit 4 Byte [uom id=114]
    Write Changes [WDU]
  ***Send Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the GAR4-DUAL POWER MOD ZY104 device.

The device GAR4-DUAL POWER MOD ZY104 supports the On command named 'DON' which accepts a parameter with enum values Off [0] and On [100]. To turn on the device, we use the On command with the parameter set to On [100].

Command to send:
- Command Name: On [DON]
- Parameter 1: value=On [100] (Enum)
- Parameter 1 permissible values: Off [0], On [100]

This will switch the device status to On.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: ZY 083 Wake Up
ID: ZY083_199
Parent: GAR0-TOOL RM SENSOR-ZY 083 [ID: ZY083_1]
  ***Properties***
    Is Awake [id=ST]
      Enum [uom id=51]
        False [0]
        True [100]
        Unknown [101]
    Keep Awake [id=GV1]
      Enum [uom id=78]
        Off [0]
        On [100]
    Wake Interval [id=GV2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Query [QUERY]
    Keep Awake [DON]
        Parameter 1: name=n/a [id=n/a]
          Enum [uom id=78]
            Off [0]
            On [100]
    Keep Awake Off [DOF]
    Set Wake Interval [SETIV]
        Parameter 1: name=n/a [id=n/a]
          Range 0 to 4660 Unit Hours [uom id=20]
          Range 0 to 279620 Unit Minutes [uom id=45]
          Range 0 to 16777215 Unit seconds [uom id=58]
  ***Send Commands***
    Keep Awake [DON]
    Keep Awake Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
What is the current wake interval setting for the ZY 083 Wake Up device?

The device ZY 083 Wake Up has a property called Wake Interval [id=GV2], which represents the current wake interval setting. However, the exact value and unit are not provided in the context, so to get the current wake interval, a Query [QUERY] command should be sent to retrieve the property values.

Since the user asked for the current wake interval, the assistant can only inform that the Wake Interval property exists and that it can be queried, but the current value is not given here.

Property:
- Name: Wake Interval [GV2]
- Unit: Can be in Hours (0 to 4660), Minutes (0 to 279620), or Seconds (0 to 16777215) depending on the unit used

To get the current value, send the Query command to the device.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: BSMT3-LAUNDRY PUMP-ZY087_1
ID: ZY087_1
  ***Properties***
    Status [id=ST]
      Enum [uom id=78]
        Off [0]
        On [100]
        Unknown [101]
    Responding [id=ERR]
      Enum [uom id=25]
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
        Parameter 1: name=n/a [id=n/a]
          Enum [uom id=78]
            Off [0]
            On [100]
    Off [DOF]
    Query [QUERY]
    Set Configuration [CONFIG]
        Parameter 1: name=Parameter Number [id=NUM]
        Parameter 2: name=Parameter Value [id=VAL]
          Range 0 to 255 Unit 1 Byte (Unsigned) [uom id=107]
          Range 0 to 65535 Unit 2 Bytes (Unsigned) [uom id=108]
          Range 0 to 4294967295 Unit 4 Bytes (Unsigned) [uom id=110]
          Range -128 to 127 Unit 1 Byte [uom id=111]
          Range -32768 to 32767 Unit 2 Byte [uom id=112]
          Range -2147483648 to 214748647 Unit 4 Byte [uom id=114]
    Write Changes [WDU]
  ***Send Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
Set parameter number 5 to value 200 on the BSMT3-LAUNDRY PUMP-ZY087_1 device.

The device BSMT3-LAUNDRY PUMP-ZY087_1 supports the Set Configuration [CONFIG] command which requires two parameters:
- Parameter 1: Parameter Number [NUM]
- Parameter 2: Parameter Value [VAL]

The Parameter Value can be in several ranges including 0 to 255 (1 Byte Unsigned), 0 to 65535 (2 Bytes Unsigned), and others.

Since the user wants to set parameter number 5 to value 200, this is valid because 200 is within the 0 to 255 range.

Command to send:
- Command Name: Set Configuration [CONFIG]
- Parameter 1 (Parameter Number): 5
- Parameter 2 (Parameter Value): 200 (Unit: 1 Byte Unsigned)

This will configure parameter 5 with the value 200 on the device.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: ZY 170 Motion Sensor
ID: ZY170_155
Parent: LR0-SENSOR-ZY170 [ID: ZY170_1]
  ***Properties***
    Status [id=ST]
      Enum [uom id=78]
        Off [0]
        On [100]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
Is the ZY 170 Motion Sensor currently on or off?

The ZY 170 Motion Sensor device has a Status property with enum values Off [0] and On [100]. However, the current value of the Status property is not provided in the given context.

To determine if the sensor is currently on or off, a Query [QUERY] command should be sent to retrieve the current Status value.

Property:
- Name: Status [ST]
- Possible values: Off [0], On [100]

Since the current status is unknown here, you should query the device to get the current status.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: ZY028-Switch All
ID: ZY028_183
Parent: GAR1-OH LTS-ZY028_1 [ID: ZY028_1]
  ***Properties***
    Status [id=ST]
      Enum [uom id=25]
        Ignore All On & All Off [0]
        Ignore All On [1]
        Ignore All Off [2]
        Ignore None [255]
  ***Accept Commands***
    All On [ALLON]
    All Off [ALLOFF]
    Options [ALLSET]
        Parameter 1: name=n/a [id=n/a]
          Enum [uom id=25]
            Ignore All On & All Off [0]
            Ignore All On [1]
            Ignore All Off [2]
            Ignore None [255]
    Query [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Set the ZY028-Switch All device to ignore all off commands only.

The ZY028-Switch All device has an Options [ALLSET] command that accepts one parameter with enum values:
- Ignore All On & All Off [0]
- Ignore All On [1]
- Ignore All Off [2]
- Ignore None [255]

To set the device to ignore all off commands only, we use the Options command with parameter value Ignore All Off [2].

Command to send:
- Command Name: Options [ALLSET]
- Parameter 1: value=Ignore All Off [2] (Enum)
- Parameter 1 permissible values: Ignore All On & All Off [0], Ignore All On [1], Ignore All Off [2], Ignore None [255]

This will configure the device to ignore all off commands only.
